1619.verse: وَرَٲوَدَتْهُ|And sought to seduce him|193|202|8902$ٱلَّتِى|she who,|80|98|232$هُوَ|he (was)|79|97|298$فِى|in|48|66|89$بَيْتِهَا|her house|85|103|8903$عَن|from|54|72|1105$نَّفْسِهِۦ|his self.|77|86|3094$وَغَلَّقَتِ|And she closed|120|140|8904$ٱلْأَبْوَٲبَ|the doors|93|132|8905$وَقَالَتْ|and she said,|108|147|2998$هَيْتَ|"Come on|82|121|8906$لَكَ‌ۚ|you."|54|93|323$قَالَ|He said,|73|92|309$مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِ‌ۖ|"I seek refuge in Allah.|169|184|8907$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed, he|91|122|396$رَبِّىٓ|(is) my lord|95|126|2902$أَحْسَنَ|(who has) made good|164|195|6192$مَثْوَاىَ‌ۖ|my stay.|82|98|8908$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed,|70|125|396$لَا|not|42|152|30$يُفْلِحُ|will succeed|100|210|5489$ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ|the wrongdoers."|133|188|2019$

1620.verse: وَلَقَدْ|And certainly|107|116|640$هَمَّتْ|she did desire|111|129|3231$بِهِۦ‌ۖ|him,|52|70|204$وَهَمَّ|and he would have desired|197|215|8909$بِهَا|her,|46|64|1203$لَوْلَآ|if not|55|73|1090$أَن|that|48|57|655$رَّءَا|he saw|67|74|5749$بُرْهَـٰنَ|the proof|82|96|8910$رَبِّهِۦ‌ۚ|(of) his Lord.|106|120|392$كَذَٲلِكَ|Thus,|77|91|702$لِنَصْرِفَ|that We might avert|155|169|8911$عَنْهُ|from him|76|90|3938$ٱلسُّوٓءَ|the evil|78|85|3816$وَٱلْفَحْشَآءَ‌ۚ|and the immorality.|147|166|8912$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed, he|91|128|396$مِنْ|(was) of|76|113|53$عِبَادِنَا|Our slaves|89|126|8913$ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ|the sincere.|123|142|8914$

1621.verse: وَٱسْتَبَقَا|And they both raced|157|169|8915$ٱلْبَابَ|(to) the door|107|131|549$وَقَدَّتْ|and she tore|104|128|8916$قَمِيصَهُۥ|his shirt|104|128|8917$مِن|from|50|74|53$دُبُرٍ|the back,|83|95|8918$وَأَلْفَيَا|and they both found|156|176|8919$سَيِّدَهَا|her husband|101|141|8920$لَدَا|at|45|85|8921$ٱلْبَابِ‌ۚ|the door.|81|121|8922$قَالَتْ|She said,|81|121|2789$مَا|"What|60|80|262$جَزَآءُ|(is) the recompense|153|161|814$مَنْ|(of one) who|106|123|76$أَرَادَ|intended|77|94|2059$بِأَهْلِكَ|for your wife|104|121|8655$سُوٓءًا|evil|71|88|4434$إِلَّآ|except|65|82|86$أَن|that|48|56|655$يُسْجَنَ|he be imprisoned|131|184|8923$أَوْ|or|41|148|154$عَذَابٌ|a punishment|108|215|72$أَلِيمٌ|painful?"|75|128|93$

1619.verse: And she, in whose house he was, sought to seduce him. She closed the doors and said, "Come, you." He said, "[I seek] the refuge of Allah. Indeed, he is my master, who has made good my residence. Indeed, wrongdoers will not succeed."

1620.verse: And she certainly determined [to seduce] him, and he would have inclined to her had he not seen the proof of his Lord. And thus [it was] that We should avert from him evil and immorality. Indeed, he was of Our chosen servants.

1621.verse: And they both raced to the door, and she tore his shirt from the back, and they found her husband at the door. She said, "What is the recompense of one who intended evil for your wife but that he be imprisoned or a painful punishment?"

1622.verse: [Joseph] said, "It was she who sought to seduce me." And a witness from her family testified. "If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth, and he is of the liars.

1623.verse: But if his shirt is torn from the back, then she has lied, and he is of the truthful."

1624.verse: So when her husband saw his shirt torn from the back, he said, "Indeed, it is of the women's plan. Indeed, your plan is great.

1625.verse: Joseph, ignore this. And, [my wife], ask forgiveness for your sin. Indeed, you were of the sinful."

1626.verse: And women in the city said, "The wife of al-'Azeez is seeking to seduce her slave boy; he has impassioned her with love. Indeed, we see her [to be] in clear error."
